alert.note: Alert for Colfax; Mora (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 20 at 3:17PM MDT until July 20 at 4:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE COOKS PEAK BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHWESTERN COLFAX AND NORTH CENTRAL MORA COUNTIES... At 317 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms which produced the heavy rain over the Cooks Peak Burn Scar had moved away from the area. However flash flooding may still be ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will produce debris flows which can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Cooks Peak Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Cooks Peak Burn Scar. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Ocate. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not camp along streams and rivers. Remain alert when hiking in steep, narrow canyons. Know where you are relative to low spots and drainages.
